out_desc_tool: The children's school performance was evaluated by obtaining The child's school grades after receiving written permission from the parents. Grades were based on a 5-point scale with a 1 indicating superior performance or a grade of A.

Language arts GPA

Grades were collected for each student for the school year prior to the study year and for the year (spring semester) of the study. Many school districts (and even schools within districts) adopt their own conventions in measuring grades, so we created a common measure of grades, allowing us to make relative comparisons of the magnitudes of impacts across sites. The vast majority of school districts assigned grades either on a 0–100 numeric scale or on an “A–F” letter scale.

Academic performance in terms of self-reported grades (eg. “on your last reported card your grades were …”) (range from 8=mostly As, to 1=mostly Ds & Fs) – mentoring

Computation of GPA was based on the following scale of grade points  A = 4 points, B = 3 points, C = 2 points, D = 1 point, and F = 0 points. Grade points for each class were tallied and divided by the number of class periods for which a grade was reported.

Tests were adapted from standardized tests of the Israeli Ministry of Education. The examinations contained a series of questions. These "anchor items," therefore, provided a metric for monitoring the children's progress from one grade to the next over the two year period.

out_desc_math: Tests were adapted from standardized tests of the Israeli Ministry of Education, some questions were adapted from the Education Testing Service of the United States. The examinations contained a series of questions. These "anchor items," therefore, provided a metric for monitoring the children's progress from one grade to the next over the two year period.

out_desc_tool: Grade Point Average (GPA). The academic grades received by all of the students involved in this investigation were collected from the school records of the students. The grades ranged from F’s to A+’s. The cumulative grade point average was then computed. The grades which were used in this computation were Mathematics, Science, and English.

The degree of the reading power subtest is a multiple-choice measure of reading ability. Its stated goal is to measure a students' ability to understand nonfiction English prose on a graduated scale of reading difficulty.

out_desc_tool: Posttest GPA comparison between mentored and similarly at risk non mentored

Participants’ grade point averages were calculated at the end of each of the three semesters they were followed  the first Fall (pretest), Spring (posttest), and the second Fall (follow-up). In order to determine a participant’s grade point average, numeric grades (0-100) in Math, Science, Social Studies, and Language Arts were first obtained from school records. Then, participants’ grades in each of these areas were averaged to produce an overall score for the semester.

out_desc_tool: Post test mean score for combined subjects academic performance (GPA) based on the academic average of five academic classes  social studies, reading, language arts, science, and math.

The baseline test took place in February 2006, and the post-test was administered to the same children (in Grade 4) in June 2007, as part of the AGEMAD project. Due to administrative constraints, only a random sub-sample of 25 students maximum per school took the test. These tests were developed from existing PASEC exams.10 They cover basic calculations and grammar questions in French and Malagasy, at the level that the students are supposed to master at this stage
No Sd's are given with the GPA means for the overall group. However, a t-value is presented for pre-post gain for at risk Youth Friends vs At Risk Control so I have used this as the primary outcome.
